title: Understanding the Functions and Graph
text:
$$\lim_{x	o-2} f(x)$$ is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the left.
$$\lim_{x	o-2} f(x)$$ is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the right.
$$\lim_{x	o-2} f(x)$$ is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from both sides.
Locate $$x=-2$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x) as it approaches that x-value.

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching as $$x$$ approaches -2?

title: Limit Value
text: $$\lim_{x\to1} f(x)=2$$ from the right. Looking at the right side of the function as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$, we can see that the value of f(x) approaches $$3$$. Remember that there is no difference with an open or closed circle because a limit is the value the graph is approaching from the right and left sides. In this case, we are looking solely at the right side of the function.\n##figure3.gif##
